title: Account Details: Names & Ownership
body:
Hello all,

When you create an account you put in your "real life" name details. When the account is created, where do the details of your name go? Also, who owns the account if it is given to a friend? As an example, my friend has more than 1 account and wants to give me one. I now have the email address set to my own and have changed the password so only I know it BUT, who owns the account? At the end of the day does it actually matter what name is used when signing up; in terms of who plays on the account? 

It might not seem an issue to some and tbh it's not really an issue for me... it's more that I'm OCD and I want my name on the account I was given! Thanks all

replies.body:
Nope, legally its not an issue, as you have  aggreed for rights to operate or loan certain things in the game with and without paying money for.

It's similar to hiring something except its virtual instead of physical.

 Remember you dont pay just to aqiure something. You can pay to receive a service or in this case, the hiring of an account (From scratch, not your mates). Think of it like hiring a car, then telling your mate you dont use it anymore so he can have it.... Which you can't.

 The only difference is you dont have to pay for the hire (Such as the free account), just pay for the fuel (Such as the RP to get skin's, icons or champ). 

Fuel disappears, just like the skins and RP etc would after the account becomes inactive or permabanned. Hope this helps.

 Anyone else feel free to elaborate on this one lol. If you get what i mean.
So many digs at Riot that I had to delete just now lol. Thanks for the clarity it really helps!

Here's a few exerts from the [ToU](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) that should help cover your questions:

> **1.3 Do I need to provide my real name and stuff?**
> You must always supply us with accurate and complete info, including if you provide us with your name, address, birthdate, email address or credit card info. We’ll use this info according to our [Privacy Policy](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/privacy).
> **1.4 Can I share or sell my account or login credentials?**
> When you create an account with us, we require you to select a unique username and password (collectively, your “Login Credentials”), which you’ll use each time you access the Game. You can’t share your account or Login Credentials with anyone (except, if you are not legally considered an adult, with your parent or legal guardian). You can’t sell, transfer or allow any other person to access your account or Login Credentials, or offer to do so.
> **4.4 Once again: I don’t own these Virtual Items?**
> NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY HEREIN, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU SHALL HAVE NO OWNERSHIP OR OTHER PROPERTY INTEREST IN YOUR ACCOUNT, AND THAT ALL RIGHTS IN AND TO YOUR ACCOUNT ARE AND SHALL FOREVER BE OWNED BY AND INURE TO THE BENEFIT OF RIOT GAMES.
> *Note: This is in bold in the ToU. It also goes on in a similar manner talking about the "game content you unlock" (for example, skins, champions, icons etc.)*

What about if someone no longer wants to play and wants you to have their account?

I find the more I learn about the fine print and the inner workings of LoL the more I dislike Riot! Basically we don't own our accounts, we don't own anything on the accounts, we give riot money in exchange for in-game money and we don't even own that. We basically spend money to play on something we don't own to have things we don't own in which these things can be taken from us at any time for any reason without warning! Am I the only one seeing a problem here :(

it's not just riot. it's most online services/products. look at apple for eg. you can have a huge collection of music via itunes. what happens when you die? can you give it to someone in your will like you could if it was a physical collection? nope because according to apple, they own it. same goes for e-book collections through amazon etc.

these kind of services and companies i think will get in trouble in the future as they aren't very clear about it and they will be forced to change.  they will need to stop using language that insinuates ownership and that you purchase products from them. eg "collection", "store", "pick up a new look for master yi", "PURCHASE RP" (they claim that they own any rp on your account so how can you be purchasing rp which would normally insinuate you have ownership of it?).

 they'll have to be like netflix where it is CLEAR from the start that you are paying for a subscription to THEIR content. everybody who pays for netflix knows they don't own anything.
i'm pretty sure it says somewhere that rito owns the account and that when you make one your just leasing it from them
Whoever created the account 'owns' it. You also cannot trade accounts as it violated the Summoner's Code. Real life information is put into the system for recovery purposes.
